doc.field: Two Native American men wearing traditional regalia
Portrait of two Native American men wearing traditional regalia including eagle feather headdresses and trailers. One holds a pistol and one a fan.
Portrait of Native American man wearing breast plate over cloth shirt and holding pistol.
Native American man wearing breast plate over vest and holding furs
Portrait of Native American man wearing breast plate over vest and holding furs.

Portrait of Red Shirt wearing shirt and vest and medallion around neck.

Type written note below photograph reads, "Red Shirt, The Fighting Chief of the Sioux Nation. Buffalo Bill's Wild West."

Portrait of Red Shirt wearing eagle feather headdress and trailer and holding pipe.

Type written note below photograph reads, "Red Shirt, The Fighting Chief of the Sioux Nation. Buffalo Bill's Wild West."
Red Shirt in front of tipi holding bow with arrow

Red Shirt wearing headdress on steps in front of tipi holding bow with arrow.

Type written note below photograph reads, "Red Shirt and Tepee. Buffalo Bill's Wild West."

Little Chief wearing breast plate over cloth shirt.

Type written note below photograph reads, "Little Chief, Chief of the Ogalallas. Buffalo Bill's Wild West."

Little Bull with feather in hair, breast plate over cloth shirt, and medallion around neck.

Type written note below photograph reads, "Little Bull, Chief of the Arrapahoes. Buffalo Bill's Wild West."

Sitting Bull wearing scarf around neck and beaded strap across chest.

Type written note below photograph reads, "Sitting Bull."

Blue Horse wearing feather in hair and breast plate over cloth shirt.

Type written note below photograph reads, "Blue Horse, Chief of the Shoshones. Buffalo Bill's Wild West."

White Eagle wearing eagle feather headdress and cloth shirt and cross around neck.

Type written note below photograph reads, "White Eagle."

Good Eagle wearing traditional regalia with medallion around neck.

Type written note below photograph reads, "Good Eagle, Chief of the Cheyennes. Buffalo Bill's Wild West."

Flies Above wearing traditional regalia.

Type written note below photograph reads, "Flies Above, Chief of the Cut-off Band of Sioux. Buffalo Bill's Wild West."
Native American women and children in front of tipis

Native Americans wearing traditional regalia standing in front of tipis. Second woman from left is John Nelson's wife and child next to her is Red Rose.

Type written note on front of card reads, "A Group of Indian Squaws and Children. Buffalo Bill's Wild West."
Native Americans in front of tipis

Native Americans in traditional regalia in front of tipis including Red Shirt and Little Bull.

Type written note on front of card reads, "Indian Warriors and Tepees, Buffalo Bill's Wild West."
Two Native Americans, one male and one female wearing traditional regalia.
Native Americans from Buffalo Bill's Wild West at Lands End, England

Eleven Native Americans from Buffalo Bill's Wild West arrayed in headdresses and beadwork standing and sitting on rocks with ocean behind at Lands End, England.

Embossed caption on mat below photograph states "The only North American Red Indians ever at Lands End, England. Selected from Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Photographed, Sunday, May 29th, 1904."
Several Native American men in front of stagecoach
Several Native American men wearing traditional regalia in front of Deadwood stagecoach in Buffalo Bill's Wild West. Tipis in background.
Native Americans in front of tipis
Group of Native Americans wearing traditional regalia standing in front of tipis at Buffalo Bill's Wild West.
Native American man, woman, and child in traditional regalia in front of tipi
Native American man, woman, and child in traditional regalia in front of tipi at Buffalo Bill's Wild West.
Six Native American men in traditional regalia in front of tipi
Six Native American men in traditional regalia in front of tipi at Buffalo Bill's Wild West. Some holding shields, coup sticks, or eagle feather staff.

Portrait of Little Chief wearing traditional regalia holding bow and arrow. He wears an eagle feather headdress, breast plate, beaded leggings, and beaded moccasins.

Printed beneath photograph, "Little Chief, 'Chief of the Ogalallar [Oglala Lakota (Sioux)],' Buffalo Bill's Wild West."
Sitting Bull and William F. Cody
William F. Cody shaking hands with Sitting Bull. Cody holds rifle in hand. Sitting Bull wears traditional regalia and Cody wears western attire.
Nine Native American men and two children in traditional regalia
Nine Native American men and two children in traditional regalia in backlot of Buffalo Bill's Wild West. Fence in background.
Five Native Americans and one non-Indian walk along roadway

Five Native Americans and one non-Indian walking along roadway with stone hedge in Penzance, England.

Hand written note on verso of print reads, "Penzance, Cornwall, England."
Native Americans in traditional regalia beside tipis

Native Americans in traditional regalia holding eagle feather staffs beside tipis in Penzance, England.

Hand written note on verso of print reads, "Penzance, Cornwall, England. 30th May, 1904."
Native American man wearing headdress and blanket standing between tipis

Native American man wearing headdress and blanket standing between tipis in Penzance, England.

Hand written note on verso of print reads, "Penzance, Cornwall, England. 30th may, 1904."
William F. Cody with group of Native Americans
William F. Cody wearing suit with group of Native Americans wearing traditional regalia and one other non-Indian. Tents in background on back lot of Buffalo Bill's Wild West.
Native Americans, men in suits, and others on banks of river with people on bridge behind
Native Americans, men in suits, and an African-American man and woman on banks of river with many people on bridge behind them.
Two Native Americans dressed in western attire holding ropes

Two Native Americans dressed in western attire holding ropes. Both wear woolly chaps and pistols on hips and stand in tent doorway.

Hand written note on verso of card reads, "Buffalo Bill Show - Europe."
Sitting Bull with feather in hair wearing fringed shirt and several necklaces.
William F. Cody with eight Native Americans
William F. Cody holding rifle standing with eight Native Americans wearing traditional regalia.
Portrait of Chief Flying Hawk wearing eagle feather headdress and breast plate over cloth shirt.
Native Americans and Charlie Yellow Boy
Group of Native Americans in traditional regalia and Charlie Yellow Boy of Buffalo Bill's Wild West.
Sioux Native American wearing headdress and beaded shirt holding eagle feather staff.
John Nelson with wife and four children

John Nelson with Native American wife and four children. John wears buckskin clothing and others wear traditional Native clothing. Young girl on right wears fully beaded dress.

Printed beneath photo, "John Nelson, and family, scout, interpreter and guide, Buffalo Bill's Wild West."
Several Native Americans from Buffalo Bill's Wild West
Several Native Americans with blankets around them and a few non-Indians from Buffalo Bill's Wild West. Tipi and trees in background.
Native American man in front of tipi
Native American man wearing eagle feather headdress with trailers and traditional regalia standing in front of tipi.
Native American man gesturing to several other Native Americans
Native American man gesturing to several other Native Americans from Buffalo Bill's Wild West. Tipis and trees in background.
Native American men sitting holding pipes
Native American men sitting holding pipes in foreground with other Native Americans and tipis in background from Buffalo Bill's Wild West.
Native American man holding hand drum and Native American woman sitting next to him

Native American man holding hand drum and Native American woman sitting next to him inside tipi. She wears cloth dress and he wears breast plate over cloth shirt. Various beaded items hanging inside tipi.
Native Americans from Buffalo Bill's Wild West on deck of Cliff House in San Francisco, California
Native Americans wearing traditional regalia from Buffalo Bill's Wild West on deck of Cliff House in San Francisco, California.
Chief Iron Tail and possibly High Eagle near tipis
Chief Iron Tail on left and possibly High Eagle on right wearing traditional regalia and standing near tipis. Another Native American in background.
Three Native American men in beaded clothing in front of tipis

Three Native American men in beaded clothing in front of tipis and large tent of Buffalo Bill's Wild West. Possibly, left to right: Brave Eagle, Black Whistle, and Black Horse.

Hand written note on verso of print reads, "For Colonel Cody, Muncie, Ind. From Harry M. Wheeler, Decatur, Ill. Aug. 1907."
William F. Cody with several Native Americans in Buffalo Bill's Wild West arena
William F. Cody wearing suit with several Native Americans wearing traditional regalia in Buffalo Bill's Wild West arena.
Several Native American men on horses at Buffalo Bill's Wild West
Several Native American men wearing traditional regalia on horses at edge of arena of Buffalo Bill's Wild West. Tipi and buildings in background.
Native American and child in doorway of tipi

Native American and child in doorway of tipi behind scenes of Buffalo Bill's Wild West in England.

Hand written below photo, "A.R. Dresser, Beccley Heath, Kent."
Native American man wearing headdress and traditional regalia from Wild West show.
Native American men and child wearing traditional regalia

Group of Native American men and one child wearing traditional regalia with tents in background from Buffalo Bill's Wild West. Three men on horses.

Written on bottom of photo, "Sioux Indians."
William F. Cody and five Native American men standing beside Cliff House
William F. Cody and five Native American chiefs (probably Sioux), including Iron Tail, in traditional regalia standing beside Cliff House, San Francisco, California.
William F. Cody and Native American man shaking hands on horses
William F. Cody wearing show attire and Native American man, probably Iron Tail, wearing eagle feather headdress, shaking hands on horses in backlot of Buffalo Bill's Wild West.
Portrait of Chief Iron Tail wearing beaded, fringed jacket, holding hat and firearm.
Chief Iron Tail wearing eagle feather headdress, breast plate over cloth shirt, and holding eagle feather staff.

Portrait of Red Cloud with feather in hair, blanket around waist, holding pipe.

Hand written note on verso of print reads, "Mochfea Luta."?

Portrait of Red Shirt with blanket around waist holding pipe and pipe bag.

Hand written note below photo reads, "Zintacolla Scaw."
Six members of the Buffalo Bill Combination

Three Native American men in traditional regalia posed with and two men in suits and one man in western attire.

Men are members of the Buffalo Bill combination.

John Young Nelson and family of Buffalo Bill's Wild West stand in front of stone block building and wood picket fence.

Imprinted below photograph "ANDERSON. 785 BROADWAY, N.Y. -- JOHN Y. NELSON and FAMILY, Scout, Guide and Interpreter of the Sioux. -- Buffalo Bill's Wild West."

Photographer inscription on verso "Anderson, photographer, 785 Broadway, cor. of 10th, New York."

Left to right: James, Thomas, Jenny (Yellow Elk Woman), John Y. Sr., Rose (in front), Julie, and John Y. Jr. (Yellow Horse), wearing headdress.
Cowboys of Buffalo Bill's Wild West in front of stagecoach

Eleven cowboys of Buffalo Bill's Wild West, including Tom Isbell (behind on right) and Silas "Cy" Compton (standing with both hands hooked in chaps), in full performance attire, sit and stand in front of stagecoach on backlot of show.
Native American man in full regalia
Portrait of Native American man dressed in traditional regalia and holding war club. Headdress resting on rocks.
Chief Flat Iron next to horse

Chief Flat Iron with scarf around head and blanket around waist holding horse tack standing next to horse behind Wild West. Another horse on right and man with bicycle to right of horse.

Hand written note under photo reads, "Chief Flatiron, Ind., O."

American Horse dressed in traditional regalia pointing pistol with one hand and holding eagle feather fan in other.

Printed beneath photo, "American Horse, Warrior Chief of the Sioux Nation, Buffalo Bill's Wild West."

Brave Chief wearing some traditional clothing over non-Indian clothing holding pistol in right hand.

Printed beneath photo, "Brave Chief, Chief of the Witehitos, Buffalo Bill's Wild West."

Julie and Jenny Nelson wearing beaded dresses and long dentalia shell earrings.

Printed beneath photograph, "Julie & Jenny Nelson, mother & daughter, Buffalo Bill's Wild West."

Portrait of Yankton Charley Plenty Wolfes wearing headdress with blanket around waist and holding rifle.

Hand written on verso of print reads, "Yankton Charley Plenty Wolfes, Shunka Manito Ota, Chief Indian Polize, Buffalo Bill Show 1890."
Two Native American men in traditional regalia with horses, and wagons behind them. Possibly behind scenes of Buffalo Bill's Wild West.

Portrait of Red Rose wearing buckskin dress with beaded yoke, necklace, and moccasins.

Printed beneath photo, "Wa-Ka-Cha-Sha, Red Rose, The pet of the Sioux, Buffalo Bill's Wild West." http://www.bbhc.org/rights/

Portrait of Lizzie Long Wolf wearing buckskin dress with beaded yoke and long dentalia shell earrings.

Printed beneath photograph, "Lizzie, Daughter of Sioux Chief, Long Wolf, Buffalo Bill's wild West."

Portrait of White Fawn and child with blanket around them and beaded strip on blanket.

Printed below photograph, "White Fawn, Sioux squaw, & Papoose, Buffalo Bill's Wild West."

Portrait of Sitting Bull and family. Left to Right: Her Holy Door, Sitting Bull's mother, seated left; Sitting Bull in center and his eldest daughter, Many Horses, with her son on her lap. Sitting Bull holds pipe and pipe bag.

Hand written note on verso of print reads, "Sitting Bull & family."

Portrait of Sitting Bull and his family wearing traditional regalia. Sitting Bull's mother, Her Holy Door sits on his right, wives Four Robes and Seen-By-The-Nation stand behind him, and his oldest daughter, Many Horses and her son sit on his left. Sitting Bull holds a pipe and pipe bag on is lap.

Hand written note on verso of card reads, "Sitting Bull & family, Ta Tonka E U tanki, Sioux."
Portrait of Long Wolf pointing pistol and wearing eagle feather headdress and moccasins.

Chief Iron Tail seated wearing hunting hat and non-Indian clothing.

Hand written note below photo reads, "Brownie Newton Picture." http://www.bbhc.org/rights/
William F. Cody speaking with Native American man beside tipi during filming of "The Indian Wars"
William F. Cody speaking with Native American man beside tipi during filming of "The Indian Wars." Two rifles lay on ground between them. People on horses in background.
William F. Cody speaking with Native American man beside tipi
William F. Cody speaking with Native American man beside tipi during filming of "The Indian Wars." Two rifles lay on ground between them. People on horses in background. http://www.bbhc.org/rights/
Native American woman carrying wood on her back
Native American woman carrying wood on her back during filming of "The Indian Wars." People, horses, and wagons in background. Dog sits on left.

Portrait of Sitting Bull holding pipe and pipe bag across lap.

Hand written signature under photo and printed note reads, "Tatonka iyotonka, The above is a true photo and autograph of Sitting Bull, the Sioux Chief at the Custer massacre."
Ghost Dog and two family members
Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Pawnee Bill's Great Far East (Show)

Ghost Dog, holding ceremonial feathers, standing with woman and female child (probably wife and daughter) in front of tipis at Wild West show; show tent and grandstand visible in background.

Hand printed at top of image, "Ghost Dog 1911." http://www.bbhc.org/rights/
Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Pawnee Bill's Great Far East (Show)

Willie Picket Pin in war bonnet, hide vest, and jewelry, sitting in front of tipi at Wild West show; in background a man naps on the ground.

Hand printed at top of image, "Willie Picket Pin, 1911."
Big Charger standing with woman and child
Miller Bros. & Arlington 101 Ranch Real Wild West (Organization)
Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Pawnee Bill's Great Far East (Show)

Big Charger standing with woman and child (probably wife and daughter) in front of tipi at Wild West show with grandstand in background.

Big Charger may have been a member of the Miller Bros. & Arlington 101 Ranch Real Wild West.

Hand printed at top of image, "Big Charger 101."
Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Pawnee Bill's Great Far East (Show)

John Painted Horse, holding staff, in full headdress and wrapped in blanket, standing in grass show arena with horses grazing in middle ground and grandstand in background.

Hand printed at top of image, "John Painted Horse." http://www.bbhc.org/rights/
Frank Brave Eagle, John Shot At and Sam Good Boy
Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Pawnee Bill's Great Far East (Show)

Frank Brave Eagle, John Shot At, and Sam Good Boy, standing in grassy arena of Wild West show with tents in background. Hand printed at bottom of negative, "Frank Good Boy, John Shot At, Frank Brave Eagle." http://www.bbhc.org/rights/
William Ghost Bear, Jas. [James?] Good Lance
Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Pawnee Bill's Great Far East (Show)

William Ghost Bear and Jas. [James?] Good Lance standing in grass in front of Wild West show tent wearing quillwork vests.

Hand printed at bottom, "Jas. Good Lance, Wm. Ghost Bear."
Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Pawnee Bill's Great Far East (Show)

Willie Picket Pin in war bonnet, hide vest, and jewelry, sitting in front of tipi at Wild West show; in background a man naps on the ground.

Hand printed at top of image, "Willie Picket Pin, 1911."
Tom Isbell, saddled horse, and stagecoach at Buffalo Bill's Wild West

Tom Isbell stands in cowboy attire of hat and woolly chaps with his hand on saddle horn of a gray horse in front of stagecoach at Buffalo Bill's Wild West.

Handwritten in pencil on mat verso "Isbell - 13."
Tom Isbell with Buffalo Bill's Wild West personnel

Tom Isbell, wearing checkered bandanna, stands with two Native Americans (one sitting) and four other men in hats (one holding dog) in front of tipi and show tent at Buffalo Bill's Wild West.

Handwritten in pencil on mat verso "Isbell - 15." http://www.bbhc.org/rights/
Tom Isbell, seven cowboys, and lady dwarf from Buffalo Bill's Wild West

Tom Isbell (far left) and seven other cowboys, all but one dressed in woolly chaps, stand with a lady midget in a dark hat and dress in front of wall of wood planks at Buffalo Bill's Wild West.

Handwritten in pencil on mat back "Tom Isbell."
Sioux Indians on the Dakota Plains
Platinotype: Two Sioux Indians, both in profile, staring in opposite directions, one adult on horseback, one child being pulled on wooden supports in a field with a dog and grazing horse
Sioux Indians on the Dakota Plains
Platinotype: Three horses and two Indian riders in a field with hills in the distance
Sioux Indians drawing in Kasebier's Studio
Platinotype: Two men from Buffalo Bill's Wild West Troop seated near a window, staring at each other
Platinotype: Four men from Buffalo Bill's Wild West Troop withh pencils in hand seated around a drawing board, three men have eyes on board, one man looking up, initials "GK" in red at lower left
Sioux Indians photographed in Gertrude Kasebier's Studio

Platinotype: Eleven Indian men with feathers on their heads sitting near a window, three men are sitting on the wooden floor, eight men in chairs, all figures are placed in the upper half of the image
Portrait of Little Finger, Sioux Indian
Platinotype: "Little Finger" wearing a gun, beads and feathers and breastplate made of bone?, standing with left fist on hip with a shield outside of a teepee
Sioux Indian Black Horse, woman, tipi

Platinotype: Indian male looking down, wearing full feather headdress and gun on left hip, standing together with a woman outside a teepee, partial view of Indian male in background, mounted with caption: "BLACK+HORSE" on lower margin of mount
Sioux Indian Spotted Tail and family, tipi
Platinotype: Indian man, woman and child all facing forward, posed outside in front of 2 teepees, mounted with caption: "Spotted-Tail" on lower margin of mount

Platinotype: Left profile of "Kills First" holding two arrows in right hand, wearing 1 feather on head, beads down left side of face and cloak with medallions, signature embossed at upper left, dark print
Platinotype: "Short Man" wearing full feather headdress, breastplate made of bone? and star-shaped badge on left side of chest and holding staff with feathers on end in both hands
Chief Joe Black Fox, Sioux Indian
Platinotype: 3/4 left view of "Joe-Black-Fox" with hands interlaced, wearing full feather headdress, red initials "GK" at lower left; "Joe-Black-Fox" in pencil on verso
Chief Joe Black Fox, Sioux Indian
Platinotype: "Joe-Black-Fox" looking at camera, holding cigarette in hand and wearing a scarf around his neck over a breastplate made of bone?, mounted
Platinotype: Full front view of "Has-No-Horses" wearing breastplate made of bone?, feathers on right side of face, earrings in left ear and fur around neck; "Has-No-Horses" in pencil on verso
Platinotype: Right profile of "Has-No-Horses" holding staff with feathers on end in left hand, feather on head, metal band above elbow, dark print; "Has-No-Horses" in pencil on verso
High Heron and Has No Horses, Sioux Indians

Platinotype: Right profile of"Has-No-Horses" standing with left hand under chin; "High-Heron" seated with blanket around right shoulder, looking to the right, embossed signature at lower right, "copyrighted 1898," mounted with caption: "HIGH HERON. HAS NO HORSES" in ink on mount
Platinotype: 3/4 view of "Samuel-Lone-Bear" seated with hands in lap, embossed signature in lower right corner, mounted with caption: "SAMUEL-LONE-BEAR", "copyrighted 1898" on mount
Platinotype: Left profile view of "Shooting-Pieces" seated and holding hammer-like object with feathers on end in left hand, "GK" in red at lower left corner; "Shooting-Pieces" in pencil on verso
Sioux Indians Black Cat, Andrew, Big Elk, Shooting Pieces

Platinotype: Group portrait of "Black-Cat, Andrew, Big Elk and Shooting-Pieces" - two men standing, wearing full feather headdresses, two men sitting on floor with hands folded in lap, mounted with caption: "BLACK-CAT+, ANDREW+, BIG+ELK+, SHOOTING-PIECES+" on lower margin of mount
Chief IronTail, Sioux Indian, in Feather Headdress
Platinotype: Right profile of "Iron Tail" with full feather headdress, initals "GK" in red at lower left corner; "Iron-Tail with his feathers" in pencil on verso
Platinotype: 3/4 view of "Iron-Tail" looking at camera, hands in lap, wearing breastplate made of bone?, green mount with caption: "IRON+TAIL" and initials "GK" on mount, (photo detached from mount)

Platinotype: "Red-Horn-Bull" in full feather headdress, seated and looking at camera, wearing breastplate made of bone? and holding staff in left hand, embossed signature at lower right and "copyrighted 1898", mounted with caption: "RED HORN BULL" on lower margin of mount; print from same negative as 69.236.044

Platinotype: Seated portrait of "Lone-Bear" in full feather headdress with bow and arrows in left hand, wearing vest with "Buffalo Bill's Police" written on a star-shaped badge, embossed signature at lower right, mounted with caption: "LONE BEAR" on mount
Kills Close to the Lodge, Sioux Indian

Platinotype: "Kills-Close-to-the-Lodge" in full feather headdress, holding staff in both hands, wearing breastplate made of bone? and metal bracelet on right wrist, signature in black at lower right, "Kills-Close-to-the-Lodge" in pencil on verso

Platinotype: Full frontal view of Sioux Indian in full feather headdress, beads on right side of face and around neck and wearing breastplate made of bone? Identified on separate mounts as "Sitting Holy" and "Kills-Close-to-the-Lodge". The Library of Congress, Division of Prints and Photographs holds the original Kasebier negative and identifies this Sioux as "Luke Big Turnips."

Platinotype: 3/4 view of "Philip-Standing-Soldier," Dakota Indian, looking at camera, holding staff with feathers on end in right hand and wearing feathers in hair, "GK" in red at lower left; "Philip-Standing-Soldier" in pencil on verso
Platinotype: Right profile of "Whirling Hawk," red "GK" at lower left. Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, original negative identifies Indian as "Charging Thunder."
Sioux and Wigwam, Buffalo Bill's Wild West camp
Platinotype: Four Indians (3 standing and 1 seated cross-legged on grass) in front of a teepee, green mount with caption: "SIOUX+WIGWAM" on lower margin of mount; photo is detached from mount
High Heron, Sioux Indian performer in Buffalo Bill's Wild West, tipi behind

Platinotype: Dakota Indian male on horseback, High Heron, wearing breastplate made of bone?, teepees in background; mounted with printer's notes: illegible blue script on left margin of mount, "2 1/2" written in blue on lower margin, "150" circled and "16545-6" in pencil on lower margin; "290E" in blue on verso
Platinotype: Left profile of Sioux male wearing earring and scarf around neck; print from same negative as 69.236.68
Platinotype: Right profile of Sioux male wearing earring and scarf around neck; print from same negative as 69.236.67 but reversed,"Sioux Indian/$5.00" on verso
Platinotype: 3/4 view of Sioux male with full feather headdress, mat board mount
Photograph of Whirling Horse, Sioux Indian mounted with drawings of buffalo, tipi, Indian and horse
Willie Spotted Horse, Sioux Indian child
Platinotype: "Willie-Spotted-Horse," small boy facing forward wearing full feather headdress and breastplate made of bone?, right hand resting over left
Wife of American Horse, Sioux Indian
Platinotype: Right profile of Sioux woman wearing two earrings in right ear and hair in braids, on ragged mount
Samuel American Horse and wife, Sioux Indians
Platinotype?: Sioux man and woman looking at camera, woman with left hand on man's shoulder, very warm print
Platinotype: Left profile of Sioux male, c. 1898
Platinotype: Full Frontal view of Sioux male wearing breastplate made of bone?, beads on left side of face and metal bracelets on both wrists, and holding staff with hair on end in both hands
Platinotype: Right 3/4 view of Sioux male wearing feathers in hair, left elbow raised with metal bracelet on left wrist, mounted; warm tone print
Platinotype: Sioux male sitting cross-legged with peace pipe
Platinotype: Sioux male, 3/4 view from back of subject
Platinotype: Sioux male, 3/4 view from front
Platinotype: Right profile of Sioux male with hair in braids, wearing two strings of beads on right side of face and ring-shaped ornament on head
Platinotype: Front view of Sioux male wearing two feathers on head, beads on left side of face, earrings in both ears, a beaded vest and fur on left shoulder
Platinotype: Sioux girl, "Zitkala-Sa," shading her eyes with her hand
Platinotype: Sioux girl, "Zitkala-Sa," with book in her lap; floral wallpaper in background
Mary Lone Bear, Sioux Indian child
Platinotype: 3/4 view of "Mary-Lone-Bear," signature at lower right
Letter, Kasebier re: Mary Lone Bear
William McGinty mounting a bucking horse
William McGinty mounting a bucking horse inside the arena of Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Congress of Rough Riders. Probably taken during a performance.
Cast members of Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Congress of Rough Riders
Cast members of Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Congress of Rough Riders during a performance. Taken in London, England.
US Cavalry of Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Congress of Rough Riders
US Cavalry of Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Congress of Rough Riders in the arena in front of a painted scenery backdrop.
Mounted cast members of Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Congress of Rough Riders
Mounted cast members of Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Congress of Rough Riders. Possibly taken during a performance.
Bronc rider with Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Congress of Rough Riders
Bronc rider with Buffalo Bill's Wild West and Congress of Rough Riders getting thrown from his horse. Taken in Europe.
